messages: 1c71954f13f66b85b556f6f7332b7500 (19:17): does this do the whole database?
1c71954f13f66b85b556f6f7332b7500 (19:17): EXEC DBMS_STATS.gather_database_stats;
2b7835ece8f55728b40b2fa7a1c653c6 (19:22): English`: Yes
2b7835ece8f55728b40b2fa7a1c653c6 (19:23): See also: gather_schema_stats, gather_table_stats, etc.

0b7abdc2173cceadb445f6361cea2bc1 (19:48): Can constraints in one table have the same name as contraints in other tables. In other words, can I have a constraint called name_uniqye in two different tables?
443a9547033ec9d695ae9d29e8df98b1 (19:49): not unless they have different owners
0b7abdc2173cceadb445f6361cea2bc1 (19:52): okay, thank you. :)
0b7abdc2173cceadb445f6361cea2bc1 (19:55): Would you recommend naming all constraints? Eg. also simple contraints like NOT NULL and UNIQUE?
0b7abdc2173cceadb445f6361cea2bc1 (19:56): Why the distinction?
16ef9805bf33329f1375a7f3b63f4569 (19:56): I"d hate to name a constraint for every column for NOT NULL
16ef9805bf33329f1375a7f3b63f4569 (19:57): that, to me, is an in-line constraint
16ef9805bf33329f1375a7f3b63f4569 (19:57): create table mytable(myval number not null, ...
0b7abdc2173cceadb445f6361cea2bc1 (19:57): Yeah, but so is UNIQUE or PRIMARY KEY?
16ef9805bf33329f1375a7f3b63f4569 (19:58): you can only have ONE primary key
16ef9805bf33329f1375a7f3b63f4569 (19:58): you can have EVERY column not null
16ef9805bf33329f1375a7f3b63f4569 (19:58): you could, I suppose, have every column UNIQUE, too, but that's not likely
16ef9805bf33329f1375a7f3b63f4569 (19:59): and both primary key and unique contraints are implemented with an index
16ef9805bf33329f1375a7f3b63f4569 (19:59): not so NOT NULL
0b7abdc2173cceadb445f6361cea2bc1 (20:01): Well yeah, but that doesn't have anything to do with constraints (the index part). :)
16ef9805bf33329f1375a7f3b63f4569 (20:01): alter table mytable add constraint mytab_uniq unique(myval);
16ef9805bf33329f1375a7f3b63f4569 (20:01): do you actually alter a table for a NOT NULL Constraint?  not usually
16ef9805bf33329f1375a7f3b63f4569 (20:01): you do for unique and primary key constraints
16ef9805bf33329f1375a7f3b63f4569 (20:02): you asked, I answered, if you're going to argue, I have better things to do
0b7abdc2173cceadb445f6361cea2bc1 (20:03): No no. I'm not arguing. I'm just not that experienced that I know what constraints I'll be modifying or nto.
0b7abdc2173cceadb445f6361cea2bc1 (20:04): Just trying to clearify. :]
16ef9805bf33329f1375a7f3b63f4569 (20:07): think about it for one minute
16ef9805bf33329f1375a7f3b63f4569 (20:08): I don't ever declare primary keys or unique constraints in-line uniess I use the constraint ... syntax
16ef9805bf33329f1375a7f3b63f4569 (20:09): create table mytable(myval number not null, ...  constraint mytab_pk primary key(myval) ...
16ef9805bf33329f1375a7f3b63f4569 (20:10): I want my pk, fk and unique constraints named
16ef9805bf33329f1375a7f3b63f4569 (20:10): so I know which table/column is affected just by querying user_constraints
0b7abdc2173cceadb445f6361cea2bc1 (20:12): Ok. That's what I want to know. :)
1c71954f13f66b85b556f6f7332b7500 (20:26): how to suppress old and new values when taking input in sqlplus?
443a9547033ec9d695ae9d29e8df98b1 (20:27): English`: set verify off
443a9547033ec9d695ae9d29e8df98b1 (20:27): if i remember correct
1c71954f13f66b85b556f6f7332b7500 (20:28): cheers mate, lets see! :)

1cae9522c294882faa236acbf49a723c (20:35): Any ides for this error during oracle-xe configure on Ubuntu (oracle-xe-universal 10.2.0.1-1.0 from .deb)? "ORA-19502: write error on file '/usr/lib/oracle/xe/app/oracle/flash_recovery_area/XE/onlinelog/o1_mf_2_%u_.log'"
1c71954f13f66b85b556f6f7332b7500 (20:43): what are you trying to do? backup?
3f80d62ed949f29a551f0f7d97ab8089 (20:44): ls -l /usr/lib/oracle/xe/app/oracle/flash_recovery_area/XE/onlinelog/
3f80d62ed949f29a551f0f7d97ab8089 (20:44): maybe rights, too
443a9547033ec9d695ae9d29e8df98b1 (20:46): MZM: disk space, file permissions?
e82e9501342385f0eabe9b304987328b (20:51): Hello. Anyone here using Sun equipment with their Oracle production servers?
443a9547033ec9d695ae9d29e8df98b1 (20:51): agnustic: probably most people
443a9547033ec9d695ae9d29e8df98b1 (20:51): what do you want to know about it?
443a9547033ec9d695ae9d29e8df98b1 (20:52): before you ask, the T2000 is "a pile of steaming dung(tm)" as an oracle server :)
e82e9501342385f0eabe9b304987328b (20:52): We are currently using an old Compuke Alpha since the90s (way before my time) and I have been given the task of reviewing possible replacement equipment
443a9547033ec9d695ae9d29e8df98b1 (20:53): what model alpha? a 1200?
e82e9501342385f0eabe9b304987328b (20:53): brb ... let me double check
443a9547033ec9d695ae9d29e8df98b1 (20:54): alpha kicked some serious ass in it's day :)
1cae9522c294882faa236acbf49a723c (20:54): sorry, I was off :)
1cae9522c294882faa236acbf49a723c (20:55): English`: I just want to install and setup Oracle XE
1cae9522c294882faa236acbf49a723c (20:56): hali: there is free space, configuration is started with sudo - shoud give root's permissions to files.
3f80d62ed949f29a551f0f7d97ab8089 (20:57): there are hell hali hile  on #solaris)
1cae9522c294882faa236acbf49a723c (20:58): hell: ls -l in mentioned directory gives 0.
e82e9501342385f0eabe9b304987328b (21:00): Never fails I get stopped in the hallway with a rather stupid question someone else could have answered
e82e9501342385f0eabe9b304987328b (21:00): It's a Compaq AlphaServer ES40 Model 2
443a9547033ec9d695ae9d29e8df98b1 (21:01): i would suggest a v490 running solaris 10 perhaps...
443a9547033ec9d695ae9d29e8df98b1 (21:01): or a HP DL585 running Linux if you are a Linux shop
443a9547033ec9d695ae9d29e8df98b1 (21:01): or a Sun x4600 if you are a Opteron lover who wants Solaris (or Linux for that matter)
443a9547033ec9d695ae9d29e8df98b1 (21:02): use what you know/like
443a9547033ec9d695ae9d29e8df98b1 (21:02): even a Dell 2950 should be sufficent to replace that...
443a9547033ec9d695ae9d29e8df98b1 (21:07): i'd probably go for the v490 or x4600 if the cost is acceptable
e82e9501342385f0eabe9b304987328b (21:08): I like what i see in the 4600
443a9547033ec9d695ae9d29e8df98b1 (21:08): it's nice and very scalable...
443a9547033ec9d695ae9d29e8df98b1 (21:08): you can even replace the processor cards with socket F cards in the future...
443a9547033ec9d695ae9d29e8df98b1 (21:08): safe investment
443a9547033ec9d695ae9d29e8df98b1 (21:08): </sales rant>
1c71954f13f66b85b556f6f7332b7500 (21:26): enterprise manager..... Oracle agent is down
1c71954f13f66b85b556f6f7332b7500 (21:26): what exactly is the Oracle agent, and how to start it on linux?
1cae9522c294882faa236acbf49a723c (21:28): distro?
e82e9501342385f0eabe9b304987328b (21:34): am i reading the hd configuration wrong ... only 4 drives on the x4600
443a9547033ec9d695ae9d29e8df98b1 (21:35): no thats correct
443a9547033ec9d695ae9d29e8df98b1 (21:36): you need a disk array for that
e82e9501342385f0eabe9b304987328b (21:37): I am just used to being able to RAID more than that
443a9547033ec9d695ae9d29e8df98b1 (21:37): you need a disk array with all the machines i listed above
e82e9501342385f0eabe9b304987328b (21:38): Okay. I understand
e82e9501342385f0eabe9b304987328b (21:38): extra RAID unit
443a9547033ec9d695ae9d29e8df98b1 (21:38): there are quite few machines on the market that can take more than say 8 internal drives
443a9547033ec9d695ae9d29e8df98b1 (21:38): none of the bigger boxes take more than 4
443a9547033ec9d695ae9d29e8df98b1 (21:38): the v490 is a two disk box
e82e9501342385f0eabe9b304987328b (21:39): I would not feel comfortable lacing the OS - data - swap on the same RAID
443a9547033ec9d695ae9d29e8df98b1 (21:39): no, thats not feasable for oracle
443a9547033ec9d695ae9d29e8df98b1 (21:40): you need at last say 8 drives
443a9547033ec9d695ae9d29e8df98b1 (21:40): 2 internal and a 12 disk external box
e82e9501342385f0eabe9b304987328b (21:41): I am thinking expandability in the future
443a9547033ec9d695ae9d29e8df98b1 (21:41): msa50 if you go hp, 3320 if you sun ... scsi wise at least
443a9547033ec9d695ae9d29e8df98b1 (21:42): msa500 is quite nice
443a9547033ec9d695ae9d29e8df98b1 (21:42): if you want fc-al hookups
443a9547033ec9d695ae9d29e8df98b1 (21:45): sun 6140 perhaps.. matches the design of the x4600 :)
